description:
A Bioinformatics Suit to Facilitate Transcriptome Analysis of Long Reads from Third Generation Sequencing Platform.

TGSagents is a bioinformatics suit to facilitate transcriptome analysis of long reads from third generation sequencing platform.

Third generation sequencing can de novo detect long reads of several thousand base pairs, thus provides a global view of the full length transcriptome.
name: TGSagents

metadata.abstract: Â© 2019 by the authors. Licensee MDPI, Basel, Switzerland.Recent analyses show that transcriptome sequencing can be utilized as a diagnostic agent for rare Mendelian diseases. The third generation sequencing de novo detects long reads of thousands of base pairs, thus greatly expanding the isoform discovery and identification of novel long noncoding RNAs. In this study, we developed TGSagents, a bioinformatics suite to facilitate routine tasks such as characterizing full-length transcripts, detecting shifted types of alternative splicing, and long noncoding RNAs (lncRNAs) identification in transcriptome analysis. It also prioritizes the transcripts with a visualization framework that automatically integrates rich annotation with known genomic features. TGSagents is a Python package freely available at Github.
metadata.title: TGSagents: A bioinformatics suit to facilitate transcriptome analysis of long reads from third generation sequencing platform
